author: s1na
content:
<@!273808422753796097> the latest that Alex and me have proposed is here: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2926
we're trying to fill in the constants (create gas overhead, etc.) now

author: .vbuterin
content: Hmm, why are you using the full binary trie spec here? Surely it's overkill for something where keys are inherently sequential and a simple binary tree suffices?

author: .vbuterin
content: hmm ok so this is not trying to fit it inside SSZ, it's using various direct byte concatenation tricks

author: s1na
content: I have a local branch for a variant with SSZ and would be happy to propose that one too. The reason the default variant uses the binary spec and simple byte concat is to reduce complexity by avoiding to introduce a merkleization and serialization rule

author: .vbuterin
content: My instinct would definitely be to favor the SSZ one simply because that moves toward reducing long-run *total* complexity of ethereum

author: s1na
content: I can fully understand that. I'll bring up both variants on ACD next time code merkleization is discussed to see what client devs think
